title: Islamic Jihad fires rockets into Israel as IDF tanks advance into Gaza
message:

title: Several Injured In Dnipro As Ukrainian Cities Targeted In Russian Strikes
message:
At least seven people were wounded in the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro on July 1 following a Russian ballistic missile attack, according to the regional governor.
The strike came a day after one person was killed and several were wounded in the northeastern city of Kharkiv when a logistics center for a courier service was hit.
People in the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, were also injured on the same day when fragments of a missile hit a multistory residential building.

title: Marines sink moving vessel at sea with new missile in Pacific training
message:
Marines sink moving vessel at sea with new missile in Pacific trainingA Marine helicopter crew sank a moving training vessel near Okinawa, Japan, using a newly acquired “fire and forget” missile for the first time in the Indo-Pacific region.
Marines used the newly acquired AGM-179 joint air-to-ground missile for the first time in such a strike mission, according to a press release.
The missile replaces both the radar-guided Longbow missile and the laser-guided AGM-114, according to manufacturer Lockheed Martin.
The weapon can be used on combat vehicles, air defense equipment, launchers, buildings, bunkers, patrol craft and command and control nodes, according to the command.
The Army also purchased the new missile to arm its Viper equivalent, the AH-64E Apache helicopter, Defense News reported.
location: The training vessel was sunk near Okinawa, Japan.
event_breakdown:
* Marines sink moving vessel at sea near Okinawa, Japan
* Marines use AGM-179 missile to sink training vessel

title: Russia devastating glide bombs keep falling on its own territory
message:
Roughly comparable to the more advanced American JDAM guided bombs, these glide bombs are large Soviet-era munitions retrofitted with guidance systems that experts say often fail — resulting in impacts on Russian territory.
The document later confirmed it was FAB-500, a glide bomb, carrying a 500 kilogram, or 1,100 pound, payload.
The Russian government has not responded to a request for comment on the document or reports of failed glide bombs.
The glide bombs are a Soviet relic hailing from the Cold War, designed as “dumb bombs” to be dropped on a target.
Glide bombs are also not as precise as cruise missiles, and often miss the target, but because of sheer explosive power they still do significant damage.
event_breakdown: Glide bombs hitting targets in Russian territory

Pol Lt Gen Piyawat Chalermsri, chief of Provincial Police Region 9, said later the vehicle used was a four-door blue pickup.

title: Russian defense ministry says it shot down 36 Ukrainian drones
message:
Russia’s defense ministry said Monday the country’s air defenses shot down 36 Ukrainian aerial drones that were involved in attacks on Russian regions along the border with Ukraine.
The ministry said Russian forces downed 18 drones over the Bryansk region, nine over the Kursk region and nine more over Belgorod.
Ukraine’s air force issued missile alerts Monday in southern and eastern Ukraine, which are frequent targets of Russian drone attacks.
Lysak said Russian attacks late Sunday included artillery and kamikaze drones that damaged several buildings and a gas pipeline in Nikopol.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reiterated his calls late Sunday for countries providing military aid to Ukraine to further relax restrictions on Ukrainian forces using Western weapons to strike military targets inside Russia.
event_breakdown: Russia defenses shot down 36 aerial drones of Ukraine on Monday.

title: 10 Islamic State militants sentenced to life again for 2015 Ankara bombings
message:
Ten suspected Islamic State militants were sentenced to life imprisonment on Monday for a second time in a retrial over their role in twin bombings that killed 101 people in Turkey's capital in 2015.
The 10 Turkish men were originally jailed for life in 2018 for planning the suicide bombings and for murder.
The men - who have denied wrongdoing and said they are not Islamic State militants - were convicted again on all offences, and again received multiple life sentences on Monday.
Turkish authorities have repeatedly said the fight against Islamic State is an utmost priority, and have denied accusations of security failings after several militant attacks.
At the time Islamic State was increasingly active in Turkey.

Last week, North Korea claimed to have successfully tested a multiple warhead missile, but the South said that launch ended in a mid-air explosion.
North Korea is ramping up weapons testing while bombarding the South Korea with balloons full of trashNorth Korea says those missives are in retaliation for balloons loaded with anti-regime propaganda leaflets sent northwards by activists in the South.
North Korea condemned joint military drills by South Korea, Japan and the United States, calling them an "Asian version of NATO" and warning of "fatal consequences".
North Korea has always decried similar combined exercises as rehearsals for an invasion, but South Korea said the latest exercises were a continuation of defensive drills held regularly for years.

title: About 20 rockets fired from Gaza Strip at southern Israel - World News
message:
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) stated that about 20 rockets were launched from the Gaza Strip toward southern Israel Monday morning, in a rare salvo from the war-ravaged enclave.
The rockets set off sirens in Kibbutz Kissufim and Kibbutz Ein HaShlosha, communities near the Gaza Strip.
The IDF issued a statement, saying "around 20 projectiles were identified crossing from the area of Khan Younis" in Gaza.
Several of them were intercepted, but some struck areas in southern Israel, and no injuries were reported.
In a statement, the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, an armed group with its headquarters in Gaza, claimed responsibility for the attack.
event_breakdown:
IDF fires rockets towards Gaza, no injuries reported 
Around 20 rockets were launched from the Gaza strip, with its source located near Khan Younis. Some rockets were intercepted, but some did hit areas of southern Israel. No injuries were reported.

message:

A military pact aimed at easing tensions has been completely suspended by South Korea in reaction to the North Korea’s frequent launches.
Concerns over the North’s improving ties with its isolated neighbour, Russia, have also grown in South Korea.
North Korea is suspected of violating arms control agreements by providing missiles to Russia for use in its conflict in Ukraine.
During the three-day “Freedom Edge” drills, participants received training in defensive cyber warfare, air and ballistic missile defence, and anti-submarine warfare.

title: Woman dead , man injured in weekend shooting , cops say
message:
GARY — Gary police are seeking the public's help identifying a man wanted in the wake of a gas station shooting over the weekend that left one woman dead and a man injured.
A man reportedly told police he was at the gas station when an unknown man pulled out a handgun and began firing at him.
The 25-year-old Gary woman was removed from the vehicle and taken to the nearby Methodist Hospitals Northlake Campus where she died as a result of her injuries, police said.
The 24-year-old Hobart man was taken to the same hospital to be treated for his injuries.
Police released a surveillance image of the man sought in the connection with the shootings.

title: N . Korea fires two short - range ballistic missiles , one fails
message:
SEOUL, July 1, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles but one launch failed, South Korea's military said Monday, a day after Pyongyang warned of "fatal consequences" following major joint exercises in the South.
In response to the North's repeated launches, South Korea has fully suspended a tension-reducing military treaty.
North Korea is also currently holding a major party meeting, which was opened by leader Kim, state media said Saturday.
"These missile launches are likely the Kim regime's way of compensating for recent failed tests, aiming to impress a domestic audience during ruling party meetings."
"Pyongyang is also determined not to appear weak while South Korea conducts defence exercises with Japan and the United States."

Location: South Korea, North Korea
Event: North Korea fires two short-range ballistic missiles. One launch failed.

title: Benny Morris : Israeli historian calls for nuclear strike on Iran
message:
Israeli historian Benny Morris has called on Israel to launch a military attack on Iran, either through "conventional weaponry" or by using nuclear weapons.
Iran launched more than 300 drones and missiles in April, in its first direct attack targeting Israeli territory.
He said that Israel had one key advantage over Iran: its current reported possession of nuclear weapons, while Iran only aspired to it.
"If Israel proves incapable of destroying the Iranian nuclear project using conventional weaponry, then it may not have any option but to resort to its nonconventional capabilities," Morris wrote, referring to nuclear weapons.
Israeli minister says nuking Gaza 'an option' Read More »Adam Raz, an Israeli historian, said Morris's proposal reflected the "all-destroying revenge strategy" that has dominated the Israeli mindest in recent months.

title: U . S . and Europe warn Lebanon Hezbollah to ease strikes on Israel and back off from wider Mideast war
message:
WASHINGTON — U.S., European and Arab mediators are pressing to keep stepped-up cross-border attacks between Israel and Lebanon’s Iran-backed Hezbollah militants from spiraling into a wider Middle East war that the world has feared for months.
Iran and Israel traded threats Saturday of what Iran said would be an “obliterating” war over Hezbollah.
Hopes are lagging for a cease-fire in Israel’s conflict with Hamas in Gaza that would calm attacks by Hezbollah and other Iranian-allied militias.
And Hezbollah should not count on its fighters’ ability to handle whatever would come next.
On both sides of the Lebanese border, escalating strikes between Israel and Hezbollah, one of the region’s best-armed fighting forces, appeared at least to level off this week.

title: Conflict rages in north Gaza as thousands displaced
message:
An injured Palestinian is brought to a hospital after an Israeli airstrike hit Bureij refugee camp in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, on Saturday.
Explosions were heard from the Shujaiya area near Gaza City, and Israeli forces advanced further on Sunday.
The armed wings of both Hamas and the Palestinian militant group Islamic Jihad said they were engaged in fighting with Israeli forces there.
The Israeli forces also pushed deeper into western and central Rafah in the south.
The conflict has also uprooted people on the Israel-Lebanon border, where the Hezbollah movement and Israeli forces have engaged in near-daily exchanges of fire.

title: Russia New 3 . 3 - Ton Glide Bomb Poses Destructive Threat to Ukraine
message:
Read previewThe Russian Aerospace Forces are using a new munition in Ukraine that might change the situation on the ground.
In June, Russian aircraft deployed for the first time the FAB-3000 M-54 glide bomb.
Ukrainian outlets reported the use of the glide bomb against Ukrainian troop concentration points in Kharkiv Oblast in eastern Ukraine.
Relying on a combination of stand-off and glide munitions, Russian aircraft have been targeting Ukrainian critical infrastructure and urban centers.
But beyond causing some additional casualties to the Ukrainian forces, Russian tactical aviation hasn't made a difference.

Event 2: Russian aircraft are targeting Ukrainian critical infrastructure and urban centers using a combination of stand-off and glide munitions. This was first reported in June and is ongoing. However, Russian tactical aviation has not made a significant impact on Ukraine.

message:

title: Nebraska Man Shoots 4 Kids , 3 Adults During Neighbor Party
message:
A Nebraska man shot seven people in what may have been a racially-motivated attack.
The Nebraska State Patrol said that 74-year-old Billy Booth opened fire on his neighbors with a shotgun while they were having a party at their home in Crete on Friday (June 28) afternoon.
There were about 15 people in the family's yard when Booth allegedly started shooting at them from inside his home.
Officials said that Booth did not get along with his neighbors and filed several police reports.
His neighbors, who are immigrants from Guatemala, filed one police report as well following an altercation with Booth.
event_breakdown: Event 1: On Friday (June 28), a Nebraska man, Billy Booth, opened fire at his neighbor's party with a shotgun, shooting seven people. The shooting appears to be racially motivated. Billy Booth, 74, had gotten into verbal altercations with his neighbors, who are immigrants from Guatemala, prior to the incident.

title: One dead , five injured in France wedding hall attack
message:
Police officers are at work on the site of a shooting that occured overnight during a wedding party in Thionville, eastern France, on June 30, 2024.
— AFPThionville, France: One person was killed and five others wounded in northeastern France when several masked gunmen opened fire at a wedding ceremony, police sources said on Sunday.
Sources suggested that the attack in the northeastern city of Thionville was linked to a settling of scores between drug traffickers.
The shooting took place at a reception hall overnight Saturday to Sunday, with around a hundred people in attendance.
“The wedding was not targeted as such, it was people who were at the wedding,” the source said.

title: Australia : Teen Arrested After Man Critically Injured In Daylight Stabbing
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Sydney, July 1 (IANS) Australian said on Monday that a teenager has been arrested after a daylight stabbing severely one man in New South Wales (NSW).
The incident unfolded at approximately 3:30 p.m. local time on Sunday when emergency services were called to Seymour Street in Bathurst following reports of a stabbing, reports Xinhua news agency.
Paramedics treated the man at the scene before he was airlifted to Westmead Hospital in a critical condition.
Following inquiries, the officers attended a home in Gormans Hill and arrested a 13-year-old boy.
Bathurst lies about 200 km west of the state capital, Sydney, with 7,001 residents living inside the urban area, according to Australia's 2021 census.

title: Police watchdog to investigate XL Bully shooting
message:
Two men were arrested after the dog attack in Eccles in which a woman was injured [JMG Press]A police force has referred itself to a watchdog over the shooting of an XL Bully dog after it attacked a woman.
Local residents said they heard several shots being fired at the dog and believed the police response was "very excessive".
The woman was injured in the attack while two men were arrested after "confronting officers", the force said.
"You don't expect to see a police officer running down your street shooting at a dog," he said.

title: Sentence handed down to teenager convicted of killing man over fireworks
message:
ST. LOUIS, Mo.
(First Alert 4) - A 19-year-old has been sentenced to 22 years in prison after a St. Louis jury found him guilty of second-degree murder and armed criminal action in the shooting death of a man over fireworks.
Devin Griffin-Curry was convicted in April of killing Rickey Jemore Lathan, 35, in the 2500 block of Semple Avenue in July 2022.
Griffin-Curry was 16 years old at the time of the shooting but was later certified as an adult to stand trial.
Lathan was standing in his yard with his children, shooting off fireworks around 11 p.m., when one of the bottle rockets hit the house of Griffin-Curry’s grandparents.

title: Germany : Knife - wielding man shot dead by police – DW – 07 / 01 / 2024
message:
Police shot the attacker at a train station near Nuremberg in southern Germany.
The man, who died at the scene, had targeted a police car and officers once they exited the vehicle.
A man wielding a knife who reportedly attacked three officers in southern Germany died after police shot him at a train station on Sunday, according to a police spokesman.
The man died at the scene of the incident in the Bavarian town of Lauf an der Pegnitz, despite first aid measures being initiated, according to the police spokesman.
The town lies 18 kilometers (11 miles) east of Nuremberg in southern Germany Image: Daniel Lob/dpa/picture alliancerm/jsi (DPA)

title: For Ukraine and Russia , a deadly summer lies ahead with little hope of big gains
message:

Russia’s thrust across the border into the Kharkiv region, launched at the end of May, appears to have caught Ukrainian forces off guard.
Russian troops, advancing in two directions, quickly seized a few villages and the northern part of the city of Vovchansk.
Russian forces inch forwardRussia has been able to replace its losses through recruitment, according to the officials, but the heavy attrition has made any advances plodding and predictable.

title: North Korea test - launches 2 ballistic missiles , after end of new US - South Korea - Japan drill
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea test-fired two ballistic missile Monday but one of them possibly flew abnormally, South…SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea test-fired two ballistic missile Monday but one of them possibly flew abnormally, South Korea’s military said, a day after the North vowed “offensive and overwhelming” responses to a new U.S. military drill with South Korea and Japan.
North Korea typically test-fires missiles toward its eastern waters, but the second missile’s flight distance was too short to reach those waters.
It said South Korea maintains a firm readiness to repel any provocations by North Korea in conjunctions with the military alliance with the United States.
The launches came two days after South Korea, the U.S. and Japan ended their new multidomain trilateral drills in the region.
North Korea said the launch was successful, but South Korea dismissed the North’s claim as deception to cover up a failed launch.
event_breakdown: North Korea test-fired two ballistic missiles on Monday, one of which possibly flew abnormally, said South Korea's military, a day after the North vowed "offensive and overwhelming" response to a new U.S.-South Korea-Japan military drill. A military official said speculation by outside experts that the missile-fired on Monday could be a hypersonic missile was not accurate. The launches, which flew from Jagang Province, come after a closed-door session of the U.N. general assembly in New York last week that focused on the nuclear standoff.

title: Palestinian ministry says Israeli raid kills woman and child in West Bank
message:
July 1, 2024 — Nur Shams (Palestinian Territories) (AFP)Palestinian officials said an Israeli raid Monday killed a woman and a child in a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, where a militant was killed the day before.
The Palestinian health ministry said in a statement that the woman and the child were killed in Nur Shams camp, near the northern West Bank town of Tulkarm.
The Ramallah-based health ministry said five others were wounded in the strike, including two who were in critical condition.
Already soaring violence in the West Bank, which Israel has occupied since 1967, has further surged since the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza broke out on October 7.
In the West Bank, at least 556 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli soldiers and settlers since October 7, according to a health ministry tally.

title: North Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles , South Korean military reports
message:
North Korea fired two ballistic missiles in a northeastern direction Monday, South Korea's military said, with one of the launches possibly failing and the missile falling inland within the country.
Another ballistic missile was launched from the same area at around 5:15 a.m. and flew only about 120 kilometers, before its trail disappeared from radar.
The North last launched two short-range ballistic missiles from the Jangyon area in March last year.
Defense Minister Shin Won-sik has said arms trade between North Korea and Russia is expected to expand after their leaders' signing of the treaty.
North Korea has ratcheted up cross-border tensions in recent weeks, launching trash-carrying balloons to South Korea in a tit-for-tat move against anti-Pyongyang leaflets sent by North Korean defectors and activists in the South.

title: North Korean missile may have failed and exploded over land , Seoul says
message:
North Korean missile may have failed and exploded over land, Seoul saysNorth Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Monday morning, but one may have failed and exploded over land, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
Photo by YonhapSEOUL, July 1 (UPI) -- A North Korean missile launched Monday may have exploded in mid-air and rained debris over land, South Korean defense officials said.
"It is possible that the second North Korean missile flew abnormally in its early stages," JCS spokesman Col. Lee Sung-jun said at a press briefing later in the morning.
Russia and North Korea have denied the allegations, but on Friday the head of a weapons research group presented evidence to the U.N. Security Council that he said "irrefutably" establishes a missile from North Korea was used on the battlefield in Ukraine.
Last week, another North Korean missile appeared to fail in mid-flight.
event_breakdown: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Monday morning, but one may have failed and exploded over land, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. The missiles were fired from the land in Wonsan, Gangwon Province, the eastern side of the peninsula, the JCS said. North Korea has been increasing its missile tests this year, firing a variety of short-range missiles and artillery pieces.

The Joint Chiefs of Staff said the missiles were launched 10 minutes apart in a northeastern direction from the town of Jangyon in southeastern North Korea.

title: The Real Story of the Soviets and the Nazis
message:
While this statistic is true, it does not mean that the USSR should be thanked for defeating Nazi Germany, or that without the USSR, Nazi Germany would not have been defeated.
This cooperation was significant: in exchange for German engineering assistance, many future famous German officers would be able to train in the Soviet Union.
Despite the ideological differences the Nazis had with the Soviets, this cooperation continued clandestinely after 1933.
In it, the Nazis and the Communists agreed to carve up Poland and the Soviets provided the Nazis with millions of tons of valuable war material such as oil, metals and even food.
The Nazis won their greatest military victories while their tanks were running on oil from the Soviet Union and being led by generals who had trained in the Soviet Union, with pilots whose instructors had attended flight school in the Soviet Union.

title: Canadian frigate visits Incheon for Indo - Pacific alliance
message:
Canadian frigate HMCS Montreal enters South Korea's western port city of Incheon on June 27.
(Embassy of Canada in Seoul)The Royal Canadian Navy’s frigate, the HMCS Montreal, arrived in South Korea’s western port city of Incheon on June 27 for a six-day mission, underscoring Canada’s commitment to the Indo-Pacific region.
The ship embarked from Canada’s East Coast in April 2024, traveling through the Middle East to make various stops in the Indo-Pacific region.
The deployment marks the first of up to three Royal Canadian Navy ships to be annually deployed under Operation HORIZON, said the embassy.
Operation HORIZON is an ongoing mission aimed at promoting peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Chad Stahelski 87Eleven Remake Bollywood  Kill  Action Thriller
message:
John Wick filmmaker Chad Stahelski is set to produce an English-language remake of the action thriller Kill for Lionsgate and Roadside Attractions.
The original Kill movie took place during a train trip to New Delhi, and saw a pair of commandos battle an army of bandits.
The train’s confines transform into a claustrophobic battleground, where martial arts meet mayhem,” the official synopsis from the producers states.
The Bollywood version of Kill is produced by Hiroo Yash Johar, Karan Johar, Apoorva Mehta, Guneet Monga Kapoor and Achin Jain.
Stahelski and his 87Eleven Entertainment banner have a deal with Lionsgate to bring the Hollywood studio original action movies to collaborate on, with an eye to establishing future movie franchises.

title: Princess Anne breaks silence after being  kicked in the head by a horse  and hospital ...
message:
Princess Anne breaks silence after being 'kicked in the head by a horse' and hospital stay with concussionBy Kit HerenPrincess Anne has spoken out after being discharged from hospital, having been treated for injuries inflicted by a horse.
Anne was forced to cancel several engagements over the past week following her injury and hospital stay.
Anne suffered minor head wounds and was kept at the hospital under observation for a few days.
Anne, 73, was walking on her Gatcombe Park estate in Gloucestershire when she was said to have been kicked by the horse, and suffered a concussion and minor injuries to her head.
Sir Tim went with Anne to hospital.

title: Unknown Newfoundland soldier who died in the First World War laid to rest at home
message:
The unknown Newfoundland soldier was lowered into a black granite tomb at around 11 a.m. local time at the National War Memorial in St. John’s.
Approximately 12,000 men from Newfoundland enlisted to fight in the First World War, and more than 3,500 were wounded or killed, according to Heritage Newfoundland and Labrador.
Monday’s ceremony laying the Unknown Soldier to rest in their homeland coincided with the 100th anniversary of the unveiling of the National War Memorial in St. John’s.
The soldier’s tomb will represent deceased Newfoundlanders and Labradorians from all branches of service who have no known grave, and thus the soldier’s identity will not be investigated.
Before the temporary cover was placed over the Unknown Soldier’s tomb, it was sprinkled with 820 blue forget-me-nots, representing the 820 Newfoundland soldiers who fought in the First World War and have no known grave.

title: Three CB90 patrol boats delivered to Ukraine
message:
The Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defence of Ukraine has received three CB90 combat boats donated by Steel Front, an organisation of military assistance provided by Ukrainian businessman Rinat Akhmetov.
The donation includes training and is worth US$4.1 million taking donations from Steel Front in support of Ukraine forces to US$200 million.
Boats are in service with Greece, Malaysia, Mexico, Norway, Peru, Sweden, Ukraine and the US Navy with platforms manufactured by Saab, ASTIMAR Tampico, Safe Boats International and Sima Shipyard.
In March 2024, the Dutch Defence Ministry announced that the Netherlands would donate three CB90s to Ukraine.
As part of a $680 million aid package to Ukraine, Sweden will supply 10 CB90 assault craft.

title: Netanyahu says end - phase of war on Hamas is close
message:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu believes that the main phase of the war against the Islamist Hamas in the Gaza Strip will soon be concluded.
Netanyahu had previously visited the Gaza Division, which is currently deployed in the city of Rafah in the south of the Gaza Strip.
Israel has been bombarding Gaza for months and started a ground offensive after Hamas' mass attack on October 7.

The words of the Israeli prime minister indicate that the Israeli army's major ground offensive in the Gaza Strip could soon come to an end.

title: Keep our troops cool : Summer heat adds to soldier challenges in war
message:
After a serious threat to the IDF was reported, more soldiers opened up describing the severe effects of overheating in army tents.
The reality is that we need those rests to keep ourselves hyper-alert.”This is the frightening reality of IDF soldiers tasked with highly sensitive missions nationwide.
Their army tents are suffocatingly hot due to the blazing Israeli sun, and widespread fatigue has been reported as soldiers find it impossible to rest.
Activists, including the organization Shomrei Yisroel, have spearheaded an initiative to combat the heat by installing air-conditioning units in army tents, providing critically needed relief from the heat.
In the words of an IDF soldier, “As a soldier on the frontline, I can’t stress enough how critical this is to keep our army alert and energized.
location: The main event is taking place in IDF army tents, which are suffocatingly hot due to the Israeli sun.
event_breakdown: IDF soldiers on the front lines of highly sensitive missions are suffering from severe fatigue due to the oppressive heat in their army tents. A campaign by Shomrei Yisroel and other activists is focusing on easing the heat by installing AC units in the army tents.

title: Russia kills 1 , injures 8 in attack on Ukraine Kharkiv
message:
Russia kills 1, injures 8 in attack on Ukraine's KharkivBy VOA News June 30, 2024Russia attacked Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city, on Sunday with a guided bomb, killing one person and injuring eight, officials said.
Russian forces launched a cross-border incursion into the Kharkiv region last month and seized several villages, but Ukrainian officials say the situation near the border has been stabilized.
Local officials say that Russia is using powerful glide bombs to attack the area.
President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Sunday that Russia had dropped more than 800 glide bombs in Ukraine in the past week alone.
Zelenskyy called on countries assisting Ukraine to further relax restrictions on using Western weapons to strike military targets inside Russia.

title: Marines on Okinawa issued new amphibious combat vehicles
message:
Marines disembark Amphibious Combat Vehicles at Naha Military Port, Okinawa, Japan, June 29, 2024.
Marine Corps)The Marine Corps received a shipment of new Amphibious Combat Vehicles or ACVs, eight-wheeled armored personnel carriers designed to move troops from ship to shore, at an Okinawa port over the weekend.
Marines of 4th Marines, 3rd Division offloaded the state-of-the-art combat vehicles, which replace an aging fleet of assault amphibious vehicles.
“Upgrading our fleet with amphibious combat vehicles capable of supporting sea denial and maritime operations will further bolster our ability to support deterrence efforts and respond to contingencies in the Indo-Pacific,” Turner said.
The amphibious combat vehicle replaced the Corps’ amphibious assault vehicles after the accidental deaths of nine Marines off the Southern California coast in July 2020.

title: SunLive - NZ army soldiers tested in tough conditions - The Bay News First
message:
Exercise Vengeance 2 – a Victor Company, 1st Battalion, Royal New Zealand Infantry Regiment (1 RNZIR) exercise – enabled its soldiers train in close country (jungle-like) environmental conditions.
Soldiers from Victor Company’s skills were tested – patrolling, ambushing, and attacking enemy positions in a close country (jungle like) environment.
Around 40,000 rounds of rifle and machine gun ammunition was used during Exercise Vengeance.
Exercise Vengeance included a scenario with an injured soldier which tested our medics’ ability to treat and evacuate patients in the field.
Freezing temperatures at altitude tested soldiers’ resilience to withstand the cold for long periods of time and still maintain performance.
location: Based on the provided text, I was unable to come up with a specific location for the main event of Exercise Vengeance.

Target Event:
Exercise Vengeance, taking place in the jungle-like environmental conditions of Waiouru Military Training Area, North Island, New Zealand, was aimed to test soldiers from the Victor Company, 1st Battalion, Royal New Zealand Infantry Regiment (1 RNZIR) in a series of tasks. The event required soldiers to practice patrolling, ambushing and attacking enemy positions in close country, and also showed how they managed to successfully treat an injured soldier in the event, to execute their more demanding rescues in powerful environments. Soldiers successfully passed all tests making it a successful step in their military development.

title: Russia attacks Myrhorod military airfield , official confirms  some losses
message:
Russian forces attacked the Myrhorod military airfield in Poltava Oblast, resulting in "some losses," former Air Force Spokesperson Yurii Ihnat confirmed on social media July 1.
Russian media sources previously circulated video footage of the strike and claimed to have damaged multiple Su-27 aircraft.
"The Air Force is doing everything to counteract the enemy, to mislead him, including with the help of models and other means," he said.
Ihnat was dismissed from his role as spokesperson on March 16, though he continues to work with the Air Force.
Russian forces previously carried out an intensive aerial attack against the Myrhorod military airfield in June 2023.

title: Dossier reveals insights into 1981 - 87 inter - Korean talks after North Korea Burma bombing
message:
The unification ministry on Tuesday unveiled newly declassified documents shedding light on inter-Korean talks on sports and humanitarian cooperation from 1981-87, following North Korea's deadly bombing attack in then Burma in 1983.
Since then, South Korea offered to hold talks with North Korea, all of which were rejected by Pyongyang.
But the situation took a dramatic turn after North Korea staged a bombing attack in Burma, now called Myanmar, in October 1983.
North Korea claimed it was an attack fabricated by South Korea, but a relevant investigation revealed North Korea was behind it, prompting Burma to sever ties with the North.
In September 1984, South Korea accepted North Korea's proposal to send rice, cement and medicine to help victims of flooding.
location: The specific location of the event is North Korea.

title: National Security Resolutions for 2009
message:
The United States should resolve to help make the world a better place with initiatives that keep Americans safe, free, and prosperous in the coming year.
Meanwhile, both the unlawful population in the United States and the number of attempted illegal border crossings are on the decline.
Requirements such as 100 percent scanning of cargo sent to the United States have been documented by the Department of Homeland Security and the Government Accountability Office as extremely problematic.
Congress should repeal ill-advised mandates and refrain from imposing excessive regulatory restrictions in the name of national security.
Changes in strategy, cuts in acquisition programs, and promises to slash fraud, waste, and abuse are all chimeras--smokescreens to cut costs without appearing weak on national security.

title: Nebraska Man Shoots 4 Kids , 3 Adults During Neighbor Party
message:
A Nebraska man shot seven people in what may have been a racially-motivated attack.
The Nebraska State Patrol said that 74-year-old Billy Booth opened fire on his neighbors with a shotgun while they were having a party at their home in Crete on Friday (June 28) afternoon.
There were about 15 people in the family's yard when Booth allegedly started shooting at them from inside his home.
Officials said that Booth did not get along with his neighbors and filed several police reports.
His neighbors, who are immigrants from Guatemala, filed one police report as well following an altercation with Booth.
event_breakdown:
Location: Crete, Nebraska
Seven people were injured in a shooting in Crete, Nebraska, on Friday (June 28) afternoon, according to the Nebraska State Patrol.
The shooter, 74-year-old Billy Booth, allegedly opened fire at his neighbor's home from inside his home while the neighbors were having a party.
The State Patrol said Booth did not get along with his neighbors and that there had been a previous altercation between the groups.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 01 July 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
Russian forces have made minor advances across a relatively broad front towards the villages of Niu-York, Pivnichne, and Pivdenne.
In the Kharkiv direction Russian occupiers 11 times forced to storm the defense borders in the area of deep, liptiv and vovchansk.
In the Kurakhiv direction, Russian forces tried to advance seven times in the settlements of Krasnogorivka, Georgiyivka and Paraskoviyvka, but unsuccessfully.
event_breakdown: Russia-Ukraine crisis: Russian forces unsuccessfully tried to advance in the Kharkiv and Kurakhiv directions, but Ukrainian defenders pushed them back. Russian forces also made minor advances towards the villages of Niu-York, Pivnichne, and Pivdenne.

title: Real  Review : Grueling Documentary Captures Footage From Russia - Ukraine Battle
message:
It’s composed of 90 minutes of raw, unedited footage captured by a GoPro camera perched on the filmmaker’s helmet while he was serving in the Ukrainian military.
Senstsov wasn’t aware that he was filming during the battle that occurred last summer, only discovering the footage months later.
Their situation is perilous; as Senstov puts it, they’re “running out of ammo and people,” with several men wounded.
They’re surrounded by Russian forces, and their location is periodically shelled as Senstov desperately attempts to arrange their evacuation.
As we eventually learn in the final moments, there were numerous Ukrainian casualties during the battle, including several of the men we see in the film.

title: How a small Minnesota town honors veterans every day
message:
And a small town in western Minnesota wants us to remember our fallen heroes — even when there isn't a holiday.
So, she got photos of all 36 Appleton soldiers who died in World War II, the Korean War, the Vietnam War and the Iraq War.
More than just getting it onto the canvas," said BonkKerry Bonk and another artist painted the faces of 36 Appleton soldiers who died serving.
Most of Appleton's fallen soldiers were in their early twenties and were killed in battle, and some had kids of their own.
"I also wonder what the town would have been like if we hadn't lost 36 of our men," said Bonk.

title: Naval Sea Systems Command Celebrates 50 Years
message:
By Naval Sea Systems Command Office of Corporate CommunicationsJuly 1, 2024WASHINGTON – Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA), responsible for the acquisition, construction, maintenance, and inactivation of ships, submarines, and combat systems for the U.S. Navy, celebrated its 50th anniversary July 1.
Since then, various organizations were established to oversee design, construction and repair of ships and ordnance.
Ultimately, in 1974 with the merger of the Naval Ship Systems Command (NAVSHIPS) and the Naval Ordnance Systems Command (NAVORD), NAVSEA was formed with then-Vice Adm. Robert C. Gooding as the first NAVSEA commander.
Vice Adm. Jim Downey, commander, Naval Sea Systems Command, attributes NAVSEA’s success – past and present – to a team of talented personnel who are committed to ensuring the U.S. Navy has the reliable combat capability needed to meet its mission sets.
A diverse command, NAVSEA hosts careers in acquisition and contracts, administration and program management, business and finance, engineering, IT and cybersecurity, science, mathematics, trades, and more.
location: WASHINGTON – Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA), responsible for the acquisition,
event_breakdown: 50th anniversary Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) also visited Indianapolis, Indiana’s Raytheon-Leonardo team for USS Indianapolis.

title: New regulations hinder donations of gear to Israeli soldiers , charities say
message:
Dozens of Israeli and American nonprofits are protesting new government regulations that, they say, have forced them to halt the flow of donated equipment for Israeli soldiers.
But the nonprofits said that the regulations make the importing process more complicated for charitable goods, effectively leaving them with no way to get their supplies to soldiers in Israel.
They say that under the old system, charities were exempt from bureaucratic obstacles that allowed them to get through customs quickly.
From the very first few weeks of the war, leaders from the Israeli military and Defense Ministry have repeatedly and falsely claimed that no shortages exist.
Volunteers and Israeli military officers have built up the logistical infrastructure necessary to field requests, fundraise from donors abroad, purchase gear and ship it to Israel.

title: 11th Airborne gets first new commander since Army Arctic command created 2 years ago
message:
Maj. Gen. Brian Eifler, outgoing commander of 11th Airborne Division and the division’s new commander, Maj. Gen. Joseph Hilbert, at the change of command at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson, Alaska, on June 27, 2024.
Army)The Army’s 11th Airborne Division, revived two years ago to serve as combat-ready unit for potential conflict near the Arctic Circle, changed command on June 27 for the first time.
Maj. Gen. Joseph Hilbert assumed command from Maj. Gen. Brian S. Eifler at the division headquarters at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson in Alaska.
Eifler has been 11th Airborne Division commander since the Pentagon reestablished the division in 2022.
The 11th Airborne Division includes two brigade combat teams.

title: Marcos vows full support to Philippine Air Force
message:
PRESIDENT Ferdinand Marcos Jr. assured on Monday, July 1, 2024, his administration's continued support to the country's armed forces to transform its operational readiness and enhance its operational reach.
Marcos made the remarks as he attended the 77th founding anniversary of the Philippine Air Force (PAF) in Mabalacat, Pampanga.
“Indeed, these assets contribute to an agile Air Force -- capable of protecting our nation, our people, and our resources; and dedicated to ensuring that we are ready to face challenges with advanced precision, speed, and force,” said Marcos.
Marcos said the government has also taken significant steps that complement and boost the administration’s vision for a stronger and more capable Air Force through increased maritime domain awareness within the Philippine Air Force Defense Identification Zone.
“We are committed to providing the necessary legislative support to ensure that the modernization programs and welfare initiatives for our armed forces are fully funded and effectively implemented,” Romualdez said.
event_breakdown:
1. President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. attended the 77th founding anniversary of the Philippine Air Force in Mabalacat, Pampanga.
2. President Marcos Jr. assured continued support for the country's armed forces to transform operational readiness and enhance operational reach.

title: Russian Air Defense Repels Ukrainian Missile Attack on Sevastopol
message:
Russian Air Defense Repels Ukrainian Missile Attack on SevastopolSputnik News20240701SIMFEROPOL (Sputnik) - The Russian air defense repelled a Ukrainian missile attack on the Black Sea city of Sevastopol on Monday, with fragments of downed aerial targets falling in the coastal area of the city, Governor Mikhail Razvozhayev said.
"We are continuing to repel the missile attack.
According to preliminary information, 4 aerial targets were destroyed in the sky above the water area and in the Balaklava district.
But fragments of downed targets fell in the coastal area and in Balaklava district.
Missile debris damaged three cars, shattered windows in a house and started a small fire in a garden community on the city's outskirts.

title: Ukrainian air base under fire as Russia aims at F - 16 arrivals
message:
Explosions reverberated across the pre-dawn sky as Ukrainian air defences fended off a Russian attack on the small city of Starokostiantyniv in western Ukraine, home to an important air base and a frequent target of Moscow’s strikes.
The air base has come under frequent attack since the first days of Russia’s February 2022 invasion, including from drones and hypersonic missiles.
A Ukrainian air force spokesman said the strikes presented “certain difficulties”, but would not undermine the delivery of F-16s or their use in battle.
The Ukrainian military, which is low on air-defence ammunition, is also likely to be forced to move the prized planes around airfields, said Justin Bronk, of the Royal United Services Institute.
Debris in cherry treesAfter last Thursday’s attack, Governor Serhiy Tyurin said air defences had destroyed nine targets over his region.
event_breakdown:
1. Explosions reverberated across the pre-dawn sky as Ukrainian air defences fended off a Russian attack on the small city of Starokostiantyniv in western Ukraine, home to an important air base and a frequent target of Moscow's strikes, Reuters reported.
2. The air base has come under frequent attack since the first days of Russia's February 2022 invasion, including from drones and hypersonic missiles, according to Ukrainian air force spokesman Leonid Matyukhin.
3. The attack lasted around 40 minutes, but failed to cause any damage to the base, Ukrainian defence minister Oleksiy Reznikov said.
4. Debris in cherry trees left after the attack has been uploaded to social media.

title: Horry County police to increase patrols in Longs after recent shootings
message:
HORRY COUNTY, S.C. (WMBF) - The Horry County Police Department says it’s increasing patrols in the Longs area after a series of recent shootings.
The latest shooting happened Saturday morning just after 5 a.m. on Sandridge Loop, where a seven-year-old was shot along with a woman in her 60s.
Horry County police are investigating three shootings in the Longs area that all occured within the past week.
“When you’re shooting at another gang member or an opposing drug dealer and you do it in this fashion, you have to know there’s innocent people in these houses and in these vehicles that you’re shooting at,” said Winburn.
If you have any information, you are asked to call the Horry County Police tipline: 843-915-8477.
event_breakdown: Horry County police are beefing up patrols in the Longs area after a rash of recent shootings. Chief Joseph Hill said patrol officers from the Horry County Police Department’s Longs-area crews have been conducting additional patrols in the area, and investigators will continue to work diligently to identify and apprehend those responsible for these three and various violent crimes in the area.

title: Kazakh Opposition Journalist Sadykov Dies In Kyiv After Assassination Attempt
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Kazakh opposition journalist Aidos Sadykov, who was in a deep coma after an attempt on his life, has died in Kyiv.
On June 18, in the Shevchenkivskyi district of Kyiv, an unidentified gunman ran up to the car where Sadykov and his wife were.
Two people are suspects in the case of an assassination attempt on the journalist.
Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said that his country was ready to join the investigation into the attack on Sadykov.
After the assassination attempt, Sadykov was in intensive care in a deep coma.

title: China H - 6K bomber displays high ballistic missile - carrying capacity
message:
China's H-6K bomber displays high ballistic missile-carrying capacityGlobal TimesBy Liu Xuanzun Published: Jul 01, 2024 09:16 PMAn official photo recently released by the Chinese military showed the outstanding capability of the H-6K bomber in carrying air-launched ballistic missiles - capable of carrying four instead of two previously shown to the public.
At the time, an H-6K bomber carrying one such missile under each wing was put on static display to event visitors.
Foreign media also noted that China Central Television for the first time released a clip showing an H-6K bomber firing the missile in May.
It revealed that the H-6K bomber has sufficient payload capacity and its wings has sufficient structural strength, the expert said.
China is not the only country that operates air-launched ballistic missiles.

title: Ukraine Faces Electricity Cuts Due To Summer Demand , Effects Of Russian Strikes
message:
Ukraine Faces Electricity Cuts Due To Summer Demand, Effects Of Russian StrikesBy RFE/RL's Ukrainian Service and RFE/RL's Russian Service July 01, 2024Ukrainian electricity provider Ukrenerho warned of blackouts and other restrictions on July 1 because of the effects of Russia's ongoing campaign of attacks targeting energy infrastructure combined with increased demand due to high summer temperatures.
The company added that Poland, Slovakia, Romania, Hungary, and Moldova were providing electricity supplies to Ukraine.
Russia has been targeting Ukraine's electrical grid for months, forcing frequent power outages.
On June 23, Russia conducted its eighth large-scale strike targeting Ukraine's energy grid in the past three months.
The strikes damaged power transmission systems in the southeastern Zaporizhzhya and western Lviv regions, Ukrenerho said at the time.
event_breakdown:
Ukraine Faces Electricity Cuts Due to Summer Demand, Effects of Russian Strikes
Ukrenerho, a Ukrainian electricity provider, warned of blackouts and restrictions in electricity supply on July 1, due to Russia's ongoing campaign of targeting energy infrastructure coupled with increased demand due to high summer temperatures.
The provider added that Poland, Slovakia, Romania, Hungary, and Moldova were providing electricity supplies to Ukraine.

title: Ukrainian air base under fire as Russia aims at F - 16 arrivals
message:
By Dan PeleschukSTAROKOSTIANTYNIV, Ukraine (Reuters) -Explosions reverberated across the pre-dawn sky as Ukrainian air defences fended off a Russian attack on this small city in western Ukraine, home to an important air base and a frequent target of Moscow's strikes.
The air base has come under frequent attack since the first days of Russia's February 2022 invasion, including from drones and hypersonic missiles.
A Ukrainian air force spokesman said the strikes presented "certain difficulties", but would not undermine the delivery of F-16s or their use in battle.
The Ukrainian military, which is low on air-defence ammunition, is also likely to be forced to move the prized planes around airfields, said Justin Bronk, of the Royal United Services Institute.
DEBRIS IN CHERRY TREESAfter last Thursday's attack, Governor Serhiy Tyurin said air defences had destroyed nine targets over his region.

title: Ukrainian air base under fire as Russia aims at F - 16 arrivals
message:
"In short, it's 'fun' to live here," said city official and local culture expert Vasyl Muliar with a wry smile, speaking after the recent attack.
"Any ground-based air defence coverage can be saturated if the Russians care enough to fire enough missiles at one target," he said.After last Thursday's attack, Governor Serhiy Tyurin said air defences had destroyed nine targets over his region.
Shortly before it, the air force had warned residents that drones were headed toward Starokostiantyniv.Local residents, careful not to divulge what might be considered sensitive military information, described living under the threat of being struck and amid the frequent roar of Ukrainian warplanes in the skies above.Iryna Sapchuk, editor-in-chief of local newspaper Our City, said her parents' home had been hit in a previous raid, damaging the roof and shed.
"It's too quiet for me," she joked, adding that the sound had become a comforting sign that Ukraine's outnumbered pilots were putting up a fight.Muliar, the local official, pointed to the city's history as a 16th-century bastion of defence and, hundreds of years later, key nerve center for independence fighters of the fledgling Ukrainian People's Republic after World War One.
"This was always a centre of resistance."

title: Israel Tells Palestinians to Leave Khan Younis as Hamas Regroups
message:
(Bloomberg) -- The Israeli army ordered Palestinians to leave Khan Younis ahead of a possible new assault, underscoring its struggle to stop militants regrouping in areas that were previously cleared.
Israeli ground forces began fighting in Khan Younis late last year and by February said they’d mostly defeated Hamas’ military units there.
“Where shall we go?” said Ahmed Al-Shami, who’s in Khan Younis.
Many Palestinians are gathering near the Nasser hospital in the west of Khan Younis.
The IDF’s latest moves in Khan Younis come as tensions worsen with Hezbollah, another Iran-backed group.

title: Nebraska Man Shoots 4 Kids , 3 Adults During Neighbor Party
message:
A Nebraska man shot seven people in what may have been a racially-motivated attack.
The Nebraska State Patrol said that 74-year-old Billy Booth opened fire on his neighbors with a shotgun while they were having a party at their home in Crete on Friday (June 28) afternoon.
There were about 15 people in the family's yard when Booth allegedly started shooting at them from inside his home.
Officials said that Booth did not get along with his neighbors and filed several police reports.
His neighbors, who are immigrants from Guatemala, filed one police report as well following an altercation with Booth.

title: Real  Review : Harrowing Doc Captures Footage of Russia - Ukraine Battle
message:
It’s composed of 90 minutes of raw, unedited footage captured by a GoPro camera perched on the filmmaker’s helmet while he was serving in the Ukrainian military.
Senstsov wasn’t aware that he was filming during the battle that occurred last summer, only discovering the footage months later.
Their situation is perilous; as Senstov puts it, they’re “running out of ammo and people,” with several men wounded.
They’re surrounded by Russian forces, and their location is periodically shelled as Senstov desperately attempts to arrange their evacuation.
As we eventually learn in the final moments, there were numerous Ukrainian casualties during the battle, including several of the men we see in the film.

Final moments of the film show exact location and place Ukrainian casualties were reported last summer
Three Ukrainian soldiers were killed and six others wounded in fierce fighting in the city of Donetsk. The Ukrainian military said Russian-backed separatists launched an attack on their positions.

title: Archaeologists Find Roman Wall Built to Trap the Legendary Spartacus
message:
In a discovery sure to capture a good deal of public attention, a team of archaeologists have found the remains of a Roman wall built to trap the forces of Spartacus, the escaped former Roman gladiator who led the most celebrated and famous slave revolt in world history.
The Roman wall was found in a mountainous area in south-central Calabria in southern Italy, where Spartacus and his rebellious forces fled in 71 BC in their efforts to escape to Sicily.
An Incredible Discovery Deep in an Italian ForestThe ancient Roman wall cuts through a section of the Dossone della Melia forest in the Calabria region in the southernmost part of the Italian mainland.
The ancient Roman wall in Calabria, Italy, which has been found to be used to trap Spartacus.
In Search of History’s Most Famous Rebel, and His PursuerExcavations at the newly discovered Roman wall will continue, and more interesting finds are expected.
event_breakdown: An Incredible Discovery Deep in an Italian Forest: The ancient Roman wall in Calabria, Italy, which has been found to be used to trap Spartacus.

title: Hezbollah member killed in Israeli airstrike on Lebanese village
message:
Beirut, July 2 : A Hezbollah member was killed in an Israeli airstrike in the village of Aitaroun in southern Lebanon, said Lebanese military sources.
An Israeli warplane fired two air-to-surface missiles at a house in the center of Aitaroun, killing a Hezbollah member on Monday, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
The military sources added that Israel launched seven airstrikes on five towns and villages and fired 45 shells on ten border towns and villages in southern Lebanon during the day.
For its part, Hezbollah announced that it attacked several Israeli sites, including Al-Samaqa, Dovev, and Ramot Naftali.
Since the start of the confrontations with Israeli forces on the border, 357 members of the Lebanese armed group have been killed, according to Lebanese security and medical reports.
event_breakdown: Aitaroun, Lebanon: On July 2, 2019, a Hezbollah member was killed in an Israeli airstrike.

title: Five Ukrainian fighter jets ruined in missile attack : Russia
message:
Moscow, July 2 : The Russian armed forces launched a missile strike on an airfield in Ukraine's Poltava region, destroying five Ukrainian Su-27 fighter jets, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday.
The attack by an Iskander-M operational-tactical missile system targeted the aircraft parking area at the Myrhorod airfield, the ministry said via its official social media channel.
It destroyed five Su-27 fighter jets belonging to the Ukrainian armed forces and damaged two more undergoing repairs at the time, reports Xinhua news agency.
The ministry also released video footage of the strike.
Ukrainian authorities have issued no immediate response.
location: The Myrhorod airfield is located in the Poltava region of Ukraine.
event_breakdown: Russian armed forces launched a missile strike on an airfield in Ukraine's Poltava region, destroying five Ukrainian Su-27 fighter jets and damaging two more undergoing repairs at the time.

title: Israel risking disastrous war against Hezbollah for political reasons , says former US official
message:
Israel risks going to war against Hezbollah to ensure Benjamin Netanyahu’s political survival, but it would be a miscalculation that could lead to mass civilian deaths in both Lebanon and Israel, a former US military intelligence analyst has warned.
He added that any Israeli government would be sensitive to political pressure from tens of thousands of Israelis displaced from the border area because of Hezbollah rocket and artillery attacks.
He argued Israel military was well aware it could not strike a decisive blow against Hezbollah’s fearsome armoury with pre-emptive strikes, as the rockets, missiles and artillery are dug into the mountainous Lebanese landscape.
Photograph: Menahem Kahana/AFP/Getty ImagesMann predicted Hezbollah would unleash a mass rocket and missile attack, if it felt it was under existential threat.
“Our least escalatory participation will be possibly striking supply lines or associated targets in Iraq and Syria to help cut off lines of communication and armaments flowing to Hezbollah,” Mann said.

The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.
Israeli forces have been battling Palestinian militants in an eastern part of Gaza City, Shijaiyah, in recent days.

title: Ukrainian air base under frequent fire as Russia targets F - 16 arrivals
message:
The air base has come under frequent attack since the first days of Russia’s February 2022 invasion, including from drones and hypersonic missiles.
A Ukrainian air force spokesman said the strikes presented “certain difficulties”, but would not undermine the delivery of F-16s or their use in battle.
Separately on Tuesday, Russia’s defence ministry said it had destroyed five Ukrainian SU-27 fighter jets at Myrhorod airfield in Poltava region.
Military analysts said the Russians were probably targeting air base infrastructure such as runways and storage facilities to make getting F-16s airborne more difficult, and, when they arrive, the Western jets themselves.
After last Thursday’s attack, Governor Serhiy Tyurin said air defences had destroyed nine targets over his region.

The Russian defence ministry said it has destroyed five Ukrainian Sukhoi Su-27 fighter jets at an airbase near the Ukrainian city of Myrhorod.
Russia's defense ministry reportedly provided evidence of the strikes on Tuesday by releasing videos of the missiles being launched.
Location: Yavoriv Military Training Ground
Reported: Tuesday, June 14, 2022
The Russian defense ministry announced that it had targeted Ukrainian air defenses using Kalibr cruise missiles.
The predawn raid struck ammunition depots, aviation equipment, and Ukrainian armor deployed in populated areas, according to Defense Ministry spokesman Igor Konashenkov.
Ukrainian media quoted officials as saying the strike hit the Yavoriv Military Training Ground in Western Ukraine. Internet damage to the facility was unconfirmed.
The Yavoriv facility, less than 15 miles from Poland, has been used in recent months by the US and its NATO allies for military training of Ukrainian soldiers.

title: Ukrainian Aircraft Destroy Enemy Ammo Depot In Crimea
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) The day before, Ukrainian aircraft struck a Russian ammunition depot in temporarily occupied Crimea.
Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk said this in a post on Telegram , Ukrinform reports.
"Ukrainian aircraft allegedly 'destroyed' by enemy propaganda continue to successfully perform combat missions, carry out missile and bomb strikes on the occupiers' positions and eliminate important military facilities in the enemy's deep rear.
On July 1, 2024, Ukrainian pilots delivered a devastating strike on an ammunition depot in Crimea," Oleshchuk said.
As reported by Ukrinform, Russia's combat losses in Ukraine between February 24, 2022 and July 2, 2024 amounted to about 545,090 troops, including 1,280 soldiers killed or wounded in action in the past 24 hours.

title: Three Islamic State Militants Killed In Iraq
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Baghdad, July 2 (IANS) The Iraqi military said Tuesday that three Islamic State (IS) were killed in an carried out the day before in the eastern province of Diyala.
The statement stated that earlier on Tuesday, an force was sent to the scene and found three bodies, including the body of an IS leader, reported Xinhua news agency.
Meanwhile, a security source told Xinhua on condition of anonymity that the killed IS leader is an Iraqi national and is wanted by the security forces for crimes of killing civilians and security personnel.
The security situation in Iraq has improved since the defeat of the IS in 2017.
However, IS remnants have sneaked into urban centers, deserts, and rugged areas, carrying out frequent guerilla attacks against security forces and civilians.
event_breakdown: Three Islamic State (IS) members were killed in an airstrikes on Tuesday in the eastern province of Diyala, the Iraqi military said in a statement. An operation force found three bodies later, including the body of an IS leader.

title: Russia Says It Destroys 5 Ukrainian SU - 27 Jet Fighters as Moscow Aims at F - 16 Arrivals
message:
MOSCOW—Russia claimed on Tuesday it had destroyed five Ukrainian SU-27 fighter jets with Iskander-M missiles and damaged two more at the Myrhorod airfield in Ukraine’s central Poltava region.
Ukraine claimed there had been a strike at the airfield but that Russia was exaggerating the damage caused.
“As a result of the Russian strike, five active SU-27 multi-purpose fighters were destroyed and two were damaged,” the ministry said.
Russia is targeting Ukrainian airfields just as Kyiv prepares to receive the first U.S.–designed F-16s, which Moscow has vowed to destroy.
Ukrainian military bloggers reported that a Russian reconnaissance drone had been able to fly above the airfield to help conduct the strike.

Russia claim to have destroyed 5 Ukrainian SU-27 fighter jets with Russia's Iskander-M missiles in the Myrhorod airfield in Ukraine's central Poltava region. Russia also claims to have damaged two more at that airfield. Ukraine said that there was a strike at the airfield but downplays the destruction. As the reason for the strike, Russia claims they destroyed 5 active SU-27 multi-purpose fighters at which they targeted and damaged two more. Russia justifies the destruction because Ukraine is about to receive U.S. designed F-16s, and Russia vows to destroy these upon Ukraine's receipt.

title: How the US should respond to Hezbollah - Israel war risks
message:
Continuing to fight Hamas in Gaza, Israel is preparing for a separate war with the Lebanese Hezbollah.
Hezbollah’s rocket and other weapons fire has forced tens of thousands of Israelis to evacuate their homes in northern Israel.
A war between these two parties would be bloody and difficult for Hezbollah in particular but also for Israel.
The question for the United States, then, is how to respond to the growing risk of war.
That concern means the U.S. should not be a party to an Israeli offensive unless Hezbollah or Iran decide to force the U.S. into that conflict.
event_breakdown: Israel-Hamas conflict, Israel-Hezbollah conflict

title: Flames Spread From House To House After NW Oklahoma City Fire
message:
A house fire in northwestern Oklahoma City escalated after flames began to spread to another residence nearby, the Oklahoma City Fire Department said.
By: News 9-Firefighters battled heavy flames Monday night after a fire at a northwest Oklahoma City duplex.
According to residents in the area, children were shooting off fireworks in the street near the structure before flames broke out, however the Oklahoma City Fire Department cannot confirm that as the official cause.
The Oklahoma City Fire Department said the fire spread from one home to another one after starting in the garage of one home.
The Oklahoma City Fire Department is continuing to investigate the cause of the fire.

House Fire in Northwestern Oklahoma City

The Oklahoma City Fire Department is continuing to investigate the cause of the fire.

title: Counter - Terror Police Takes Charge Of Investigation Over Sydney University Stabbing
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Sydney, July 2 (IANS) A counter-terrorism force has engaged in the investigation after a teenager stabbed a 22-year-old student at the University of Sydney on Tuesday morning.
The wounded student, identified as an Australian national, was rushed to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital in a serious but stable condition.
Police confirmed the identity of the alleged assailant as a 14-year-old local who lives in Sydney's inner west.
The University of Sydney is located less than 3 km southwest of the city's central business district.
Vice-Chancellor and President of the University of Sydney Mark Scott expressed his feeling of being "deeply shocked and saddened" while assuring the community that there is no ongoing threat.

title: Iran - backed Houthi Group Confirms Targeting US , united kingdom , Israeli Ships In Multiple Sea Attacks
message:
Yemen's Houthi group announced on Monday that they had conducted four military operations, targeting ships in the Red Sea, Arabian Sea, Mediterranean Sea, and Indian Ocean.
Reuters reported that, according to Yahya Sarea, the spokesperson for the group, the operations were aimed at vessels linked to the United States, the United Kingdom, and Israel.
The first operation targeted the Israeli ship MSC Unific in the Arabian Sea.
Sarea added that a second operation struck a U.S. oil tanker, Delonix, in the Red Sea, marking the second attack in that region within a week.
The Houthi group, aligned with Iran, has been carrying out drone and missile strikes in shipping lanes since November, citing solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.

title: Khan Younis residents told to evacuate as Israel plans new offensive
message:
The Israeli army on Monday ordered Palestinians living in eastern areas of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip to immediately leave ahead of a possible new ground assault.
The army earlier sent audio messages to residents telling them to leave before posting a message in Arabic repeating the warning on social media.
The area ordered to be evacuated also includes the Gaza European hospital, which is one of the few hospitals operating in the Gaza Strip.
Earlier, the Islamic Jihad group said it fired a barrage of rockets from the Khan Younis area towards Israeli areas bordering Gaza.
The Israeli army did not report any casualties or material damage from the incident, however.

title: Mum who stopped Luton bike thief  let down  by police
message:
A mum who used taekwondo moves to stop a thief stealing her motorbike said she felt "let down" by police.
Xristina, 31, wrestled the robber, claiming to be a 12-year-old boy, to the ground at Hatters Way retail park in Luton, but gave up and released him after 10 minutes.
She said a police car had passed the scene earlier and only returned after the thief had escaped.
Bedfordshire Police said it had carried out several lines of inquiry and an investigation was ongoing.

title: At least 19 dead in drug gang clash in Mexico - World
message:
MEXICO CITY: At least 19 people were killed, four of them Guatemalans, in a turf battle between two drug gangs in the southern Mexican state of Chiapas, authorities said Monday.
An initial investigation said the clash was between the Sinaloa cartel, one of the most powerful in Mexico, and another gang identified as the “Chiapas and Guatemala” cartel.
The Mexican government deployed an additional 1,200 personnel to reinforce the country’s southern border with Guatemala.
Violence has escalated in recent years in Chiapas state.
Voting was suspended in two municipalities in Chiapas state due to a spike in violence that prevented polling booths from being set up, officials said.

Monterrey: Ten people were killed in a shootout between security forces and gunmen at a house in the Monterrey suburb of Monterrey. Officials said the police were on a routine patrol in the area when they came under fire.

title: Saab releases details on Sirius Compact EW sensor
message:
Saab has sold “thousands” of its Sirius Compact passive electronic warfare (EW) sensor systems in past the two years since the product was released but only in three versions of the four systems.
(Photo: Saab)All four systems provide 360° coverage, have 100GB storage and power consumption of 60W, with integrated IMU and GNSS.
The smaller land sensor, L20R, weighs 5.2kg and has a height of 46cm and diameter of 15cm covering 2-18GHz.
The L21R is similar but weighs 5.8kg and has a height of 48cm and diameter of 17cm covering 1-18GHz.

title: MoD inks MoU to set up 3 testing facilities in Tamil Nadu Defence Corridor
message:
The Ministry of Defence has signed an MoU to establish three state-of-the-art testing facilities in Chennai under the Tamil Nadu Defence Industrial Corridor- one each in Unmanned Aerial System (UAS), Electronic Warfare (EW) and Electro-Optics (EO) domains.
The MoU, under the Defence Testing Infrastructure Scheme (DTIS), was exchanged between senior officials of MoD and Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation Limited in the presence of Defence Secretary Giridhar Aramane in the national capital.
To provide impetus to the defence and aerospace sectors within the Defence Industrial Corridors, seven testing facilities were approved - four in Tamil Nadu and three in Uttar Pradesh.
The MoU for three facilities in Tamil Nadu has been signed today.
Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) and India Optel Limited (IOL) are the lead SPV members in the EW and EO testing facilities respectively.
event_breakdown:
* MoU signed for three state-of-the-art testing facilities in Chennai under the Tamil Nadu Defence Industrial Corridor in the realms of UAS, EW and EO.
* Defence Testing Infrastructure Scheme (DTIS) and Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation Limited involved in setting up these testing facilities in Chennai.
* Defence Secretary Giridhar Aramane witnessed the MoU exchange in Delhi.
* Seven testing facilities in total, four in Tamil Nadu and three in Uttar Pradesh, to be established to push defence and aerospace sectors.
* Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) and India Optel Limited (IOL) leading the EW and EO testing facilities in Chennai respectively.

title: IDF Destroys Largest Islamic Jihad Rocket Manufacturing Site Found To Date
message:
The IDF announced that its troops located and demolished the largest Palestinian Islamic Jihad rocket manufacturing site found to date in southern Gaza’s Rafah.
The site, located in the Tel Sultan neighborhood, was raided by troops from the Commando Brigade, 401st Armored Brigade, and the elite Yahalom combat engineering unit.
According to the IDF, the underground facility was used by Islamic Jihad to manufacture rocket parts and long-range rockets, producing hundreds of projectiles in recent years.
The site was identified as the terrorist organization’s largest rocket manufacturing hub in the Gaza Strip.
The military utilized drones and guided missiles to neutralize several Islamic Jihad operatives, ensuring the successful destruction of the site.
